intro: Deiregyne riodelayensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Deiregyne riodelayensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
